text: have you ever had carnitas those crispy
delicious pork chunks usually served in
tacos if you have you know how fantastic
they are but I bet you didn't know how
simple they are to make all you have to
do is cut up some pork shoulder I have
two pounds but you can use as little or
as much as you want
into about one inch chunks and then it's
ready to start cooking it's super simple
you take your pork you put it into a
straight sided skillets it's not
supposed to be preheating but my
preheated mine cuz I'm so used to doing
it adds water to cover and what you want
to do is bring it to a boil reduce it to
a simmer and then cook it turning the
pork every once in a while until the
pork is tender that should take about 45
minutes when the liquid comes to a boil
some phone will come to the top I like
to skim that foam off it doesn't say to
in the recipe but otherwise it just sort
of cooks on to the pork as its cooking
so skim off the foam if you'd like now
that all the water has evaporated
the pork is starting to sizzle it in the
pan and what you want to do is just turn
the heat up a little bit and now you
have to kind of watch it because what
you want to do is crisp the pork on the
outside and see some of these pieces are
already getting crisp a little bit
that's what you're looking for all over
the pork you can season your pork now
with salt and pepper keep cooking it if
I take up to 12 minutes but it could
take less depending on how hot your
stove is to get everything crispy and
delicious looks crispy to me I'm taking
it off the fire and I'm just gonna stir
it in some tacos alright get ready to
make tacos all of your taco toppings are
up to you I like to put avocado and
pretty much everything as you may know
you'll slice and scoop method I have
some limes two of the tiniest limes I
have ever seen these are not key limes
but we are having a lime shortage
please look juicy and they smell good so
a little is all you need anyway
tortillas put over the gas flame and
then wrap the
in a clean kitchen towel to steam and
get pliable these are such cute little
ones I think I might use to the way they
do it my taco card in my neighborhood
add some pork pork some Kurama a little
bit of avocado a little bit of diced
white onion you do not need to do this
if you don't like raw onion leave it out
or you can add some salsa here delicious
with salsa some cilantro and a squeeze
of lime couldn't be more delicious I'm
just gonna go ahead and have some right
now take a bite and you're not gonna
believe that you made it at home so

for peace deliciousness
